comment: He wants to get out of there quick, so he skips around the procedure, which makes me so confused. He'd then degrade and yell too. He's quite lazy, which came in handy because he would give us As on labs he doesn't even take up. However, he would give 90s, which meant you needed to get a 90 on the final to make an A. I'm pretty sure he curved it.
Professor Ghosh is really nice, however he can be hard to understand. Also, his expectations aren't always clear, and his grading is somewhat inconsistent. He's slow about responding to emails.

Overall, this lab was easy. However its a lot o independent work. Show up, do you lab, when you're done leave finish the lab and bring it to the next class. If you want an A in the class just do the work and read prelab. Only down side to the professor is that you can't understand him at all because of his accent, but if you read before you're fine

You can barely understand him when he talks, he has a thick and fast Indian accent. He barely explains the lecture portion and barely helps with the lab part. He wouldn't let us stay the whole class to finish our lab notebook and ask him questions- he made us leave as soon as we finished the lab. everyone failed his quizzes so he gave us 100s
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He assigns weekly homework, has quizzes every other week, and drops the lowest grade of each.  He is hard to understand but you can follow him by what he writes on the board. He is very lenient. All but two people failed one quiz, so he dropped it. He is really nice and willing to help. You need to attend to get the information for the lab reports.
Ghosh is so nice and helpful! He is a little hard to understand but he is so helpful if you ask questions. Go to class and do the labs and you'll make an A!

Gosh is amazing! Yes he can be hard to understand but don't let this frighten you, give him a chance! He is there for you whenever you have a question, he wants everyone to make an A! Nicest lab professor at kennesaw and the labs are not hard coming from someone who has to work hard to make an A in Chem. I highly recommend!

Do not take!!! He is hard to understand, and the lab assistant is the one actually explaining stuff and helping. Ghosh is very hard to understand, and he can say something to belittle or embarrass you if you ever ask him a question. He is quick to judge and make assumptions about people before you even talk to him.
